definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: Food retailers have cashed in on this opportunity with zeal.
sentences.chinese: 食品零售商怀着热情利用了这一商机。

sentences.english: This will bring much business opportunities, inestimable .
sentences.chinese: 这将带来多大商机，难以估量。

sentences.english: Finally, an AD can bring unlimited business opportunities for the night and a large consumer.
sentences.chinese: 最后，广告可以为起夜带来无限商机和年夜量消费者。

sentences.english: Now the business opportunities available on the mainland are at least as big a draw for returnees.
sentences.chinese: 现在大陆的商机至少对海归是一个巨大的吸引。

sentences.english: The promotion event brought new business opportunities to Sichuan.
sentences.chinese: 这次推介会为四川省带来了新的商机。

sentences.english: American liquor companies are finding inspiration in the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 时下，美国酒商从经济危机中发现了商机。

sentences.english: Major network operators naturally not miss this rare opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 各大网商自然不会放过这个难得的商机。

sentences.english: The country thrusted the hardbound room policy actually to give the building materials market to bring the new opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 国家力推精装房的政策却给建材市场带来了新商机。

sentences.english: The last but not the least, ads can bring commercial opportunity and large groups of customers to the stores.
sentences.chinese: 最后，告白能够为起夜带来无限商机和大量消费者。

sentences.english: We will sincerely continue to cooperate with old and new customers for a brilliant furture.
sentences.chinese: 我们真诚希望与广大新老客户继续合作，共创商机。

sentences.english: Efficiency, expertise, market size, low-risk profit.
sentences.chinese: 高效率，专业性，市场宏广，低风险的商机。

sentences.english: Philippe careful study of the invention after, Patek smell business opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普审慎的研究，发明之后，百达翡丽的气味商机。

sentences.english: A hot business opportunity is based on a long-term trend not a short-lived fad.
sentences.chinese: 一个热门的商机指的是长期的趋势而非一时的流行。

sentences.english: The plots on both sides of Century Avenue usher in excellent opportunities for development.
sentences.chinese: 世纪大道两侧的地块充满着无限的商机。

sentences.english: Frank has a very keen (sharp) vision and he can seize any business opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 小杨同学眼光敏锐，总能抓住一切商机。

sentences.english: Now, cut the staff back to Ho Park of Harbin to seek business opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 现在，裁掉了员工的朴之浩回到哈尔滨寻找商机。

definition: the first pot of gold/the initial profits from an economic endeavour
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
